key_points: The suspect in the Michigan high school shooting had meetings with his parents and school officials due to concerning behavior hours before the attack.
Four students were killed and seven others were injured in the shooting at Oxford High School, with suspect Ethan Crumbley charged as an adult.
Oakland County Sheriff Michael Bouchard stated the suspect's office was unaware of any alarming behavior prior to the shooting.
Two teachers raised concerns about the suspect's behavior, leading to meetings with school officials.
The gun used in the attack was bought by the suspect's father four days before the shooting.
Oakland County Prosecutor Karen McDonald is considering charges against the suspect's parents.
McDonald highlighted a 'mountain of digital evidence' suggesting the shooting was premeditated.
At the arraignment, it was revealed the suspect had made videos and kept a journal outlining plans for the shooting.
The suspect faces life without parole if convicted.
Prosecutor McDonald called for revisiting gun laws in light of the shooting.
